input: The Constitution of India guarantees the Fundamental Right to Freedom of Religion to all its citizens. Which among the following is not true for this Rights?

options.A: It gives freedom of conscience and freedom to profess, practice and propagate any religion
options.B: It gives freedom to establish and maintain institution for religious and charitable purposes
options.C: The Right is subject to public order, morality and health
options.D: The State cannot make any law which abrogates this Right for citizens

explanation: The state can make laws which abrogate the right in case there is a threat to public order, morality and health.
